subject: RE: [junit] Re: Running my junit tests using ant
msgSnippet: The ANT web site has plenty of useful information: http://ant.apache.org/manual/OptionalTasks/junit.html There s also this:
messageBody:
The ANT web site has plenty of useful information:
http://ant.apache.org/manual/OptionalTasks/junit.html

There's also this:
http://www.geekfarm.org/emeade/junit/AutomatingJUnitTestingWithAnt.htm

Both of these links, as well as many, many more were found by entering
the following text in Google:
ant + junit

-----------------------------
Mike Silverstein
SilverMark, Inc.
The Object Testing Company
www.javatesting.com
**********************************
* Makers of "Test Mentor" *
* and "Enhanced JUnit" Java *
* component testing tools *
**********************************

>
> The O'Reilly book, "Java Extreme Programming Cookbook" has a
> chapter on JUnit and Ant along with several good examples.
>
> Good luck,
>
> Michael
> "boothana" <boothana@...> wrote in message
news:bjk72f+oc8j@......
> Could some body please point me to a tutorial or some documentation
> where i can find information on how to run my tests using ant.
>
